alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Delaware (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 04 at 8:06PM CDT until May 05 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Illinois River at Chewey affecting Adair, Cherokee and Delaware Counties. Illinois River near Tahlequah affecting Cherokee County. Illinois River near Watts affecting Adair and Delaware Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Flint Creek near Kansas affecting Cherokee and Delaware Counties. Baron Fork River at Eldon affecting Cherokee County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Flint Creek near Kansas. * WHEN...From this evening to late Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, minor flooding occurs from Fidlers Bend to Chewey Bridge. Permanent campgrounds and farmlands are affected. Turbulence makes the river unsafe for floating. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 11.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.0 feet early Thursday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
